subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Business Growth: Start-Ups, Investment and Negotiation
headline: Learn how negotiation, investment, development and fundraising can help businesses grow in this free online course.
description: This free online business course will be of great interest to anyone thinking about starting up a company. Business leaders and entrepreneurs offer their teachings on a range of subjects, from the importance of corporate culture to effective negotiation. They also discuss how to find angel investors for your business and why fundraising is such an important skill for entrepreneurs. So if you want to excel in business, start your learning today.

courseDescription:
This course begins by discussing personal achievement, looking at how thinking like a traveler, treating life as an experiment and doing what you love can help you achieve success. It goes on to talk about how important it is to be able to cope with failure and learn from your mistakes, as well as the importance of creating meaning for employees in order to maximise their productivity.


The course moves on to talk about how you can transfer the culture of a big company into your start-up, how small companies can use speed to compete with giants in the same market and what financial institutions can offer companies beyond mere money management. The course then moves on to discuss being a venture capitalist and the impact of social entrepreneurship as well as how to attract angel investors to partner with your company.


Finally, the course looks at the art of negotiation, why effective negotiation is important in so many areas and why it's important to treat negotiations as if you may run into the same people further down the road. The course also discusses product development and understanding your customers as well as the success and ecosystem of Silicon Valley. These are all vital things for the aspiring entrepreneur to understand, so start your learning journey today.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Personal Success and Meaning for Employees
modules.description: In this module you will learn what it takes to achieve personal success, including doing what you love and treating life as an experiment, as well as how to create meaning for employees in your business.
topics: Personal Success and Meaning for Employees - Learning Outcomes
Achieving Personal Success
Creating Meaning for Employees
Personal Success and Meaning for Employees - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn the importance of culture within a company, why it can be more important than strategy, how big company culture can be transferred to start-ups and how commercial banking as been able to help tech companies.
topics: Company Culture and Commercial Banking - Learning Outcomes
Transferring Big Company Culture to Startups
How Commercial Banking Helps Technology Companies
Company Culture and Commercial Banking - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Venture Capitalism, Angel Investors and Non-Profits
modules.description: In this module you will learn about achieving success as a venture capitalist, why risk is necessary for businesses to grow and how to go about getting angel investors to support your business.
topics: Venture Capitalism, Angel Investors and Non-Profits - Learning Outcomes
Succeeding as a Venture Capitalist
Why Risk is Necessary for Business Growth
How to get Angel Investors Supporting Your Business
Fundraising for the Non-Profit
Venture Capitalism, Angel Investors and Non-Profits - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module you will learn about the art of negotiation and why they are serial events. You will also cover the product development process and take a look at the success of Silicon Valley.
topics: Development and Negotiation - Learning Outcomes
Introducing the Art of Negotiation
Rethinking the Product Development Process
Understanding the Success of Silicon Valley
Development and Negotiation - Lesson Summary

topics: Business Growth: Start-Ups, Investment and Negotiation course assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain the most important foundation piece for any business.
    • List the most important elements of decision making.
    • Discuss why coping with failure is an important part of business.
    • Explain why creating meaning for your employees is important.
    • Summarize the importance of fulfillment in getting the most out of people.
    • Analyze the significance of culture in a business.

  • Lesson Summary

    • A solid partnership is one of the most important foundation pieces for any business.
    • You should choose your founding partner based on who you want to work with when things get tough.
    • Learning from mistakes and adapting is crucial to avoid making them over and over again.
    • Creating meaning for employees enables them to be passionate about their work.
    • Responsibility, accountability and authority are the three most important parts of decision making.
    • Protecting the culture of a company can be vital to its success.
    • It is important to create an environment in which people can excel.
    • Entrepreneurs should always be learning to promote growth and knowledge.
    • Being passionate about your work will make you better at it.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain how smaller companies can compete with bigger, more established businesses.
    • Define the two forms of capital in business.
    • Discuss why culture is of greater value than strategy in a business.
    • Explain the pros and cons of being a private or a public company.
    • Discuss the work/life balance.
    • Explain the services a financial institution can offer a growing company.
    • Summarize how you can make more money by spending less.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Giving people freedom and trust can spark their passion and drive innovation.
    • For small companies to compete with giants, speed of execution is key.
    • Investors in the post 'dot com bubble' era are more thoughtful and analytical.
    • It is important to make room for relationships outside of work, even for people who are deeply passionate about their job.
    • Cracking big markets can take more than finding a niche, to be successful your business must be sustainable.
    • Building great corporate culture motivates the team.
    • Hiring diverse and intelligent people can help create a pleasant and productive culture.
    • Squeezing vendors, outsourcing labor and removing unnecessary steps from processes are all ways to lower cost and raise profits for a business.
    • Commercial banks can offer businesses more than a place for money management, including networking, advice and connections.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain what marks out a successful company.
    • Summarize why fundraising is such a critical skill for an entrepreneur.
    • List the steps to becoming a venture capitalist.
    • Explain why risk is a necessity in business.
    • Explain what an Angel Investor does for a business.
    • Discuss whether a start-up business can raise too much money.
    • Analyze the impact of social entrepreneurship.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Passionate founders and a devotion to excellence are two distinguishing marks of successful companies.
    • John Doerr believes entrepreneurs can be seen as missionaries rather than mercenaries.
    • Coaching and personal networking are helpful tools in building a strong team.
    • Social entrepreneurship can have a major impact on challenging issues around the world.
    • The path to being a venture capitalist starts with being a great entrepreneur, according to John Doerr.
    • Being passionate about what you do enables you to overcome difficult times.
    • Peter Diamandis believes offering high-profile cash prizes can be more financially advantageous than funding a good idea.
    • True breakthroughs only come when people take risks.
    • An angel investor provides capital for a business start-up, often in exchange for equity.
    • Too much money can create a toxic environment in a start-up company.
    • Fundraising for a non-profit should be seen as sharing an opportunity rather than begging for money.

    • Fundraising for a non-profit should be seen as sharing an opportunity rather than begging for money.

    • Being passionate about what you do enables you to overcome difficult times.
    • Peter Diamandis believes offering high-profile cash prizes can be more financially advantageous than funding a good idea.
    • True breakthroughs only come when people take risks.
    • An angel investor provides capital for a business start-up, often in exchange for equity.
    • Too much money can create a toxic environment in a start-up company.
    • Fundraising for a non-profit should be seen as sharing an opportunity rather than begging for money.

  • Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Define what a negotiation is.
    • Explain why negotiations are serial events.
    • Discuss the best way to negotiate salaries.
    • List the steps of the standard product development model.
    • Discuss why seeking publicity too soon can be a bad thing.
    • Discuss what makes an effective negotiation.
    • Explain the three circle strategy.
    • Summarize the reasons to focus on building a brand.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Negotiations should be treated as if you will encounter the same people in the future.
    • Stan Christensen defines negotiation as any attempt to persuade or influence a party to do something.
    • Communication - convincing the other side that you can hear them and they are being heard - is a key element in successful negotiation.
    • Having a good idea about the objective criteria is key to effective negotiation of salaries.
    • The standard product development model is: concept, development, alpha test, beta test, first customer, ship.
    • Too many variables in the early stages of growing a business make seeking early media coverage a big risk.
    • Having a strong understanding of your customers is vital for the success of a company.
    • John Roos defines the three circle strategy at Wilson Sonsini as 1) advising small private companies, 2) guiding young public companies and 3) servicing billion dollar companies.
    • Focusing on building a brand early on is likely to pay off in the long run.
